title: Prisma Schema
ques: What is the single source of truth in a **Prisma** project?

answer.content:
The **`prisma.schema`** file.

It defines your database connection, generator settings, and your data models using a custom DSL (Domain Specific Language).
`model User { id Int @id ... }`

explanation: You don't define models in JS/TS classes.

title: Type Safety
ques: How does Prisma provide better Type Safety than other ORMs?

answer.content:
It **generates** a bespoke TypeScript Client based on your schema.

If you have a customized query `select: { name: true }`, the return type is automatically adjusted to *only* contain `name`. Accessing `.email` will throw a compile-time error.

It reads an **existing database** schema (tables/columns) and automatically generates/updates the `prisma.schema` file to match it.

This is great for adding Prisma to legacy projects with an existing DB.

title: Prisma Client
ques: Prisma Client uses a **Query Engine**. What language is this engine written in?

answer.content:
**Rust.**

Prisma Client (JS/TS) talks to a binary engine written in Rust. This creates a high-performance abstraction layer that handles connection pooling and query construction.

explanation: This architecture is unique to Prisma.
